title: Amaze is amazing. (Too cheesy?)
comment: I'm a big fan of anything open source. I love the "Material" UI and the ability to change the theme colors. I'd like to incorporate this app into my own ROMs. Thank you for making it open source and not including ads. You're awesome.
Great!

comment: Looking forward to the updates looks like Google made it for lollipop, keep up the great work.

title: Amazing Concept
comment: The design is absolutely gorgeous. I want to use this as my main file explorer, but it needs some added features such as a text editor, zip viewer, and r/w functionality needs to be fully implemented. Oh, and maybe a material design app icon (; That being said, this app is amazing and deserves five stars once it is up to par. Thanks dev, keep it up

title: Good
comment: Best interface

title: Just need...

title: Just what I've been looking for
comment: I love this manager!  Perfect combination of form and function.  Beats all the other file managers I've tried!

title: Simply beautiful
comment: Great design, easy on the eyes and easy to navigate. I have one issue, no editor? I was attempting to make a edit to build.prop, but noticed no editor. I opened with ES Note and made the change, but that would be my only complaint. Other than that, excellent!

title: Fantastic
comment: Loving it
Pretty nice and stable for v1 but you should include a share option

title: Amazed by the ui...
comment: I'm in Love with the ui.. Since download I've forgotten about es-explorer.. and I can move multiple files at once., donno why others cant.. And What it really lacks is support for zip and other compressed formats..

title: This is actually good
comment: I don't know why others are saying that multiple transfer isn't possible, or maybe I just thought that I have done it. 4★ for now though. Congrats, looks good

title: Please, for the love of God
comment: Add a '/' for the filesystem root to the slide out menu. You'll get the 5th star when I see it. This is common in virtually every file manager. I'm not sure why you skipped adding it.
Surely in next update

title: This app...
comment: ...is amazeballs.

title: Very good file manager and love the Skins
Wonderful

title: The most beautiful file manager out there!
comment: This is by far the most beautiful file manager out there.But it has a bit confusing settings options...it can become one of the most popular for members in the play store.

title: Cool app
comment: Looks and works much better than other competitive apps. But Material style dialog boxes could've added to is beauty. If you could manage that & bookmarks would be easier to access in navigation drawer. Else a very good file manager

title: Ui
comment: Ui attracts people

title: Looks Amazing. Needs a couple features.
comment: I love the look of this file explorer. Had an issue with it force closing when trying to write to the external SD Card but that's a known KitKat issue so I can't take points off for that. Would love to see a text editor and possibly a .zip peak ability without having to extract it completely. Fantastic start for a great app.

title: Nice Material Design !
comment: Though its not as advanced as others, still UI is awsum :) hope you will add more features like 'file details', 'zip-unzip' in subsequent Updates :)

title: needs more.
comment: great start but needs more.  ftp / smb / cloud access.  zip viewer and extractor.  without these its just a pretty app that can't  compete with ES File Manager.

title: Awesome work
comment: One suggestion though. Please put the bookmarks in the quick slide out panel on the left and put the bookmarks manager in the menu. Right now it doesn't make much sense how it is.

title: Xiaomi mi3
comment: Loved it,keep improving it.

title: Gorgeous file Manager with best design
Almost perfect
comment: I like it a lot. It's finally the one browser that does everything and looks good doing it. My only gripe is that it would be nice if bookmarks showed in the hamburger menu. Its kind of weird that it just shows a link to what looks like an unfinished or unpolished bookmarks list.

title: Cool design!
comment: Good to see material ui...there's always a room for improvement. One suggestion would be adding the text editor  of its own. Keep it up!

title: Amazing!
comment: Amazed like Amazing.Really nice new root browser with themes support.Just something diff between others file managers.I like this app on first look.Thanks to developers.

title: Materially Nice
comment: This is a fantastic basic file manager. But, most of us looking for a file manager need more. It's in beta, so it will get better. If the Dev can build in more attached features (NAS mapping) I'll definitely be back. Until then, ES it is.

title: Love it! Needs cloud storage?
comment: Found this on the xda feed!

title: Early impression
comment: 5 stars after first impression. I will edit if that changes. Good work Dev.

title: Few things...
comment: Really nice, and may ditch RE once more updates come. Nice work so far tho. One request tho, ability to move files and move multiple files at once. No ability to move files/multiple files at once drives me away from many file managers. Like it so far tho.

title: Nice
comment: Nice looking app, can you add LAN support then it be perfect.

title: Nice and smooth!
comment: Awesome! Well done! Can't wait to see what else is added.

comment: Really like how is laid out. .

title: I can dig it!
comment: Looks good. Only complaint is when showing permissions it makes folders look a mess

title: Meh...
comment: Too many theming options, an app manager... this is one of those apps which try to be too much. It would better be a useful root explorer but nothing more.

title: Great filemanager
comment: Awesome filemanager with the material design language.

title: Amazing
comment: This file explorer has lollipop theme and root. And solid as solid explorer

title: Pretty fast, lightweight and quite good
comment: Very good overall, nice and fast, no extra bloat or dodgy permissions.. Good start... However ... Please make the header smaller.. It's HUGE! .... Also I dont like the big round red plus button in the bottom right corner - please add an option to make it smaller, to move it or to make it transparent (whichever is easiest for you and gets it out the way more) ... Also, I can't tell what the 3rd option does in the 'plus button' menu ... ? ... Please make that clearer ..  .. Finally (if I am being super fussy) if you added very lightweight and simple image viewer, simple doc reader/preview, google drive upload .. then it would be very powerful as well..  See Tomi file manager for ideas..

title: Nice
comment: Best out there

title: Really liking the app
comment: Looks like the developer is working hard to make this a nice all around file manager. Still needs some work for functionality, but its coming along really nicely. Going to keep this installed to see where it goes! Good work so far! And the themeable UI is just awesome!
Nice

title: Great Effort!
comment: The UI is no doubt overwhelming, but the interface is way too simple. For a noob that might be a good thing but for power users such as myself I'll keep ES explorer by its side.

title: Great

title: Almost perfect

title: My new favorite.
comment: This is the best material design file manager I've found. I was going to comment that it needs a better icon, but the icon here on the Play Store looks ok. Unfortunately, for some reason, that is not the icon in the app, and therefore not the icon that shows up on my phone. Can we get an update with the new/better icon included?
Thanks for the feedback. We'll fix the app icon with a better one in the upcoming update.

title: Sweet
comment: Looks awesome and very fluid. Perfect for the average user, but your leaving us power users out in the cold with no zip support. Either way, highly recommended.
zip support will take time
Shows great promise

title: Needs little improvements
comment: The app is nice, but it needs some improvements like: 1.The top part might be of a lesser height. Right now I feel it covers too much of space. 2. Darker status bar (no problem with the existing implementation, but it would look better with a darker status bar).

height of top bar is inspired from material design.
darker status bar is possible for android 5 only for now

title: SD card issue on non rooted KitKat.
comment: Hopefully fixes will come soon.
It doesn't work for external SD card on KitKat devices. Due to restrictions on 3rd party app by Google. However we'll try to find a work around to this.
